title: Introduction to C Programming
description: This course is an introduction to the fundamentals of C programming. It covers topics such as variables, data types, operators, control flow, functions, and objects.

title: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming with Python
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of computer science and programming using the Python programming language. It covers topics such as variables, data types, functions, loops, conditional statements, and object-oriented programming.

title: Introduction to JavaScript
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of the JavaScript programming language. It covers topics such as variables, data types, functions, loops, conditional statements, and objects.

title: Basic Data Structures
description: This course teaches you how to program games using the Python programming language. It covers topics such as object-oriented programming, graphics, and animation.

title: The Complete Web Development
description: This course teaches you how to build websites from scratch using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It also covers topics such as responsive design, WordPress, and React.js.

title: Angular 2 Fundamentals
description: This course teaches you the fundamentals of the Angular 2 framework. It covers topics such as components, directives, pipes, and services.

title: The Complete React JS Course
description: This course teaches you how to build React applications from scratch. It covers topics such as components, props, state, and routing.

title: Software Engineering
description: A Software Engineer is an IT professional who designs, develops and maintains computer software at a company. They use their creativity and technical skills and apply the principles of software engineering to help solve new and ongoing problems for an organization.

title: Database (MySQL)
description: MySQL Database is a client/server system that consists of a multithreaded SQL server that supports different back ends, several different client programs and libraries, administrative tools, and a wide range of application-programming interfaces (APIs)
